perturbation.original_text: Promoter is an independent contractor and not an officer, director, affiliate, insider, employee or agent of VNUE or any of its subsidiaries or affiliates. Promoter has no authority to, and will not, enter into contracts, make representations, warranties or commitments purporting to be binding on VNUE or otherwise act on VNUE’s behalf and shall not take any action that might lead third parties to believe Promoter has the right to do so.
perturbation.changed_text: Promoter is an independent contractor; however, Promoter may act as a limited agent of VNUE for the sole purpose of securing venue contracts. Promoter has the authority to present standard VNUE contract terms but must receive explicit written approval from VNUE for any deviations.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a contradiction regarding the Promoter's authority. Initially, the agreement states the Promoter has no authority to bind VNUE. The modified text grants the Promoter limited agency to secure venue contracts, implying the ability to bind VNUE to some degree, contradicting the initial statement of no authority. It's unclear what constitutes a 'standard VNUE contract' and what deviations require approval.

perturbation.original_text: Section 3. Expenses. VNUE shall reimburse Promoter for expenses incurred by Promoter while performing the duties herein. Promoter shall deliver to VNUE an itemized accounting of expenses incurred on a weekly basis, and VNUE shall reimburse Promoter within Thirty (30) Days of receipt of such accounting.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 3. Expenses. VNUE will consider reimbursing Promoter for pre-approved expenses incurred while performing duties herein, at VNUE’s sole discretion. Promoter shall submit an itemized accounting of expenses within 60 days of incurring them. Reimbursement, if approved, will be processed within ninety (90) days of VNUE's expense approval.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates reimbursement of all expenses with a specific timeline. The changed text makes reimbursement discretionary ('will consider') and introduces pre-approval, changing the conditions for reimbursement and creating a contradiction. The original section guaranteed reimbursement, while the new section does not.

perturbation.original_text: Section 6. Term. This Agreement shall commence on September 10, 2015 and shall continue for One (1) Year (the “Term”). At any time prior to the end of the Term, the Parties may agree in writing to extend the Agreement for successive One (1) Year periods (the “Renewal Terms”) under the same conditions set forth herein.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 6. Term. This Agreement shall commence on September 10, 2015 and shall continue for One (1) Year (the “Term”). VNUE has the option to renew this Agreement for an additional one (1) year period, under modified terms at VNUE's discretion, by providing written notice to the Promoter 30 days before the end of the initial term. If VNUE does not renew, the agreement will automatically transition into a month-to-month agreement until either party provides 30 days written notice of termination.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires mutual written agreement for renewal under the same conditions. The changed text gives VNUE unilateral control over renewal, potentially under different terms. It then introduces a month-to-month agreement upon non-renewal, which was not present in the original term. This creates conflict because it alters the requirements and conditions for extending the contract, especially since the promoter has no say in the potential renewal terms.
